bibl.title: Fletcher Decker v. State of Washington. Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus an Writ for Certiorari
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT IN AND FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF FLETCHER DECKER FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS AND WRIT OF CERTIORARI.))))
ORDER FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS & WRIT OF CERTIORARI.

This matter coming on to be heard this day before the above named court upon an order heretofore issued herein directing James H. Boyle, United States Marshal in and for said District, to show cause if any he have why an order for a writ of Habeas Corpus and a writ of Certifiorari should not be issued by this court, and Beeler & Sullivan appearing as attorneys for the above named Petitioner, and Charlotte Kolmitz, Assistant U.S. District Attorney in and for said District, and Tucker and Hyland appearing for said Marshal, and it appearing to the court that the said Petitioner is now restrained of his liberty by said Marshal at the County Jail of King County, State of Washington, and after hearing argument from the respective counsel, and being fully advised in the premises, and it further appearing to the court from all and singular the law and the premises that a writ of Habeas Corpus and a writ of Certiorari should be issued herein, and now upon motion of Beeler & Sullivan, attorneys for said Petitioner.

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED AND ADJUDGED that the Clerk of this court be and he is hereby directed to issue a writ of Habeas Corpus under the seal of this court directed to James M. Boyle, United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, commanding him to have the body of the said Fletcher Decker before this Court on Tuesday, the 13th day of September, 1921, at ten a.m., to do and receive what shall then be considered by the court and the he, the said Marshal have then and there the said
writ.
Done in open court this 9th day of September, 1921.
Jeremiah Neterer J U D G E.
LB#9 Page 70 FILED IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT Western District of Washington NORTHERN DIVISION TH SEP 9 1921 F.M. Harshberger, Clerk By D.E. Leitch Deputy
